page.title: 18OAKLANDS COLLEGE:ST.ALBANS
page.content: These are the animals we saw at the farm at Oaklands College. There are 120 Friesian{cows}some of which are calves. The cows only give milk after the birth of their{first calf}and are milked at 6am and 3 p.m. It takes only a few seconds. Oaklands Farm have 85 ewes. They usually have 2{lambs}each between February and March. When the lambs are 35kg they are sold to the meat trade and in December the ewes are sheared. The{pigs}are of the{Large {White}breed and most{sows}have around 12{piglets.}At 6 weeks they are taken to the fattening house.
